rating.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a level on a scale that shows how good, important, popular etc someone or something is
rating.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: By the end of the year the prime minister’s approval rating (=how many people agreed with his policies) had fallen as low as 12 percent.
rating.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a letter that shows whether or not a film is suitable for children
rating.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: ‘The Godfather’ had an X-rating when it was first shown.
rating.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a sailor in the navy who is not an officer
rating.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: His previous highest approval rating was 58 percent.
The rating he gave the restaurant was embarrassingly low.
They received different pay increases even though their performance ratings were the same.
We can’t give you the loan because you have a bad credit rating.
Each restaurant is given a star rating.
I'd only give this PC a rating of two out of five.
The Department of Computer Science received a top rating last year.
The president's approval ratings have risen considerably.
rating.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a level on a scale that shows how good, important, or popular something or someone is
rating.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The President’s popularity rating has never been higher.
The show is several ratings points ahead of its nearest rival.
rating.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a measurement of the risk of lending to a company etc, calculated by an independent organization called a RATINGS AGENCY
rating.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Standard and Poor’s downgraded (=reduced) the rating on Pacific’s commercial paper to single-A-3 from single-A-2.
Moody’s upgraded (=improved) its  rating on Disney’s senior debt to double-A-3 from single-A-2.
rating.translation[1].definitions[2].def: an estimate of the future profitability of investing in a particular company
rating.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: Kidder Peabody recommended Texas Instruments stock, which carries the firm’s highest investment rating.
rating.translation[1].definitions[3].def: a measurement of the risk of loss, used to calculate how much will be charged for insurance
rating.translation[1].definitions[4].def: a measurement of how many people watch a television programme or listen to a radio programme
rating.translation[1].definitions[4].exa: CBS Evening News slipped to second place in the ratings.
rating.translation[1].definitions[5].def: the class in which a ship or machine is placed, according to its size
